intro: Stachytarpheta procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. The plant produces tubular flowers that are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine, silky hairs. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
